poem:
**Morning Reverie**

Newsprint whispers:  
cousins lost to time,  
fruit heavy with secrets,  
a lamp's glow beckons film,  
and whales breach the page.  
Names etch walls like echoes,  
while Chile's eye builds  
under skies vast.  
  
The day unfurls—  
questions linger  
like gentle fog,  
awaiting sun to pierce.  
In this quiet,  
I find my pen.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What links Lauryn Hill and Jon Bon Jovi? The Saturday quiz The questions 1 Which first cousins were executed, respectively, in 1536 and 1542?2 What fruit has the highest fat content?3 The desk lamp Luxo Jr is a mascot of which film company?4 What was first published in October 1851 as The Whale?5 Which Yorkshire cricketer’s name was graffitied on the Berlin Wall?6 Under construction in Chile, what is the ELT?7 What is the offspring". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
